subclusters.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of oxidized and chemically modified proteins due to posttranslational modifications and loss of protease activity leading to enzyme dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidized protein accumulation, protein carbonylation, and role of heat shock proteins in maintaining mitochondrial and cellular proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of oxidatively modified proteins affecting metabolic pathways and proteostasis failure due to oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights accumulation of oxidatively damaged proteins, decline in proteasome and repair systems, and posttranslational modifications as aging hallmarks.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidatively modified proteins accumulation and decline in proteasome activity/content in epidermal cells during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Posttranslational Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteasome activity decline leading to accumulation of oxidized and cross-linked proteins in senescent cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in proteasome activity causing accumulation of oxidized proteins and feedback inhibition of proteasome function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteasomal activity decline causing accumulation of damaged proteins and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteasomal adaptation to stress and its role in maintaining protein homeostasis and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline of ubiquitin-proteasome system activity due to protein aggregation causing a negative feedback loop impairing proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in proteostasis network efficiency, linking lipid assemblies and aging-regulating pathways to proteostasis failure and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteostasis network decline in brain aging, leading to protein aggregation and neurodegenerative disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis failure involving proteasomal degradation and autophagy decline contributing to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights proteostatic collapse as a loss of cellular information processing leading to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteostasis network impairment in aging and Alzheimer's disease involving chaperones, UPS, and autophagy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis network decline causing protein aggregation, cellular dysfunction, and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes age-related decline in proteostasis network capacity and its modulation by longevity pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Insolubility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on loss of proteostasis leading to accumulation of insoluble protein aggregates (core insoluble proteome) driving aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Insolubility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein conformational changes and aggregation causing tissue dysfunction and common late-life conformational diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Insolubility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on intrinsic aggregation propensity of proteins causing toxicity and aging, buffered by molecular chaperones.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Insolubility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein aggregation in heart aging and hypertension linking proteostasis impairment to cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on defective proteostasis in hypothalamus causing inflammation, metabolic dysfunction, and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis maintenance via proteasome and autophagy in plant aging and senescence, highlighting regulatory pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains tissue-specific regulation of heat shock response based on proteostasis substrate load and chaperone balance.
